div.head: CAP. IX
Concerning the institution of circumcision and its cause.
div.p: Abraham first received the command of circumcision in order to prove obedience. Circumcision was commanded not only to him, but to his offspring, that is to all Hebrews, which was that according to the law on the eight day he cut, with a stone knife, the flesh of the foreskin.

However circumcision was given for many reasons, namely so that through obedience of the law Abraham would please God, whom Adam had displeased through his transgression. It was also given as a sign of the great faith of Abraham, who believed, that would have a son, from whom the blessing of all would come. Against, so that with this sign the people would be distinguished from other nations.

But circumcision in the flesh of the foresking was commanded because it was instituted as a remedy for original sin, which we receive from our parents through concupiscence, which dominates most greatly in this part. And because in this part the first man sensed the guilt of disobedience, it was appropriate that he accept the sign of obedience there.

But it happen on the eight day, with a stone knife, because in the common resurrection, on the eight day, through the rock Christ every corruption will be removed from the elect. And through the resurrection of Christ, made on the eight day, the soul of anyone believing in him will be circumcised from sin.
Therefore two things belonging to this sacrament. Hugo, Sum. Sent. tr. 4, c. 1 (PL 176, 119) .

Moreover therefore, circumcision was changed to baptism because the sacrament of baptism is more common and more perfect because it has accumulated grace more fully. For in baptism sin was not only dismissed, but there neither the grace helping us to do well, nor the possession or augmentation of virtue is surpassed, such that in baptism, where sins are not just destroyed, but also helping grace is conferred, and virtues are increased. Whence the water of refreshment is said to be that which makes dry places fertile and gives already fruitful places more abundance; because, however much through faith and love before the habit someone just will receive more abundant grace, but this is not the case with circumcision. Whence for one already justified through the faith of Abraham it was only a sign, and did nothing for him internally.
